instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
No liquid damage, 3ports measure 4.98v .29a but one only mesures 5v 0.12a
3v3_g3h measures 2.5v on the 3 ports and 0v on the 1 port (bottom right when using macbook normally)

Are schematics available for this yet? im using a 000293

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
Please disregard just saw Louis has a video for charging issues.
replaced the CD3215C that was getting hot and now all working.

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
This board has a wierd issue where it doesnt go to sleep properly hence draining battery very quickly.
when put to sleep machine remains warm after a few hours, also if I leave the capslock key on and put it to sleep the LED never goes out

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
Check SMC_LID signal in sleep mode.
All S0 voltages should go down; check that too.

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
SMC_LID while sleep 3.48v(open) 0.1v(closed)
5v_s0 3v3_s0 are up
PPVCC_S0_CPU fluctuating bet 0.2-0.7v

Just noticed when put to sleep with capslock on afte rabout 20seconds the light goes out for 1 second then comes back on

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
When sleeps, no S0 voltage should be on.
PM_SLP_S3_L should go down for this.

BTW, do you reffer to put system in sleep mode from software (with trackpad), or just closing lid?

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
PM_SLP_S3_L stays high, I've tried both methods and both have the same results.

Worth an ME region cleaning?

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
SMC_LID goes low in both cases?
Also check SMC_LID_LEFT/RIGHT.
If any bad, check HALL_SENSOR_LEFT/RIGHT and U5255.

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: SMC_LID only goes low when lid is closed even when put to sleep with trackpad, all SMC_LID stuff seems to be measuring right

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: Can you check if backlight goes off when close the lid?

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: yes backlight goes off when lid is closed

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
So the system receives correct signal, but keeps S0 state active; this is really strange.
PM_SLP_S3_L remains high too?

Disconnect any unnecessary device from the board, like TP/KB, etc.
Use USB mouse and keyboard; see if any behaviour changes...

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
yeah really weird screen goes off and when i wake it its at the login screen but it just keeps the machine in an s0 state

Unplugged everything except screen still same behavior

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
just noticed the capslock LED keeps cycling, i timed it
LED stays on for 11.5seconds then turn off for 1.5s and the cycle repeats

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
Try clean ME, just in case.
But doesn't look like issue here.
Don't forget to make a backup first.
Also try your test USB OSX, to discard a software issue.

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: Tried to clean ME and different OSX, issue persists

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
Same thing on battery alone, without charger?
Could be some wake signal issue.
Inspect if you moved something on the board when replaced the CD3215...

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
same thing on batt or charger. Area is clean arround CD3215.
When I plug something into the port that the CD3215 was for it goes to sleep properly

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: So that port works correctly, no sleep issue?

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: if i plug something into the port then the machine works properly no sleep issue, if i plug it into other ports issue persists

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
Did you solder the same CD3215 chip, from donor?
Be aware of termination, aka C00, B03...

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: took it from a 820-00840 same CD3215C00

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
Change, or reflow that chip.
Or change the other CD3215 chips from the board; as your issue seems to be related with them...

threads.title: 820-00923 No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
reflowed chip same prob
Changed chip same prob

only have 1 other chip still waiting for new ones.
